txt.en: Pursue Athálrik
It is serene here among the pines, the wind brushing thoughtfully through the grass
TBD
Find Athálrik
Find Athálrik
Confront Athálrik
'Uh huh huh huh.'
'It is too much! Yet... I will hear more.'
'Who are you then? What did you see?'
You have tracked Athálrik to his retreat in the highlands west of Lake-town.
'Ah, but I know what you are.'
'You're the one dogging my heels, lying, turning the Queen against me.'
Defeat Athálrik
'Do not think you have caught me yet.'
'You have come far to find me. You can go a bit farther.'
'You there, boys! Look sharp!'
Search Athálrik
'See that that this rat gets what they've got coming.'
Find Athálrik
'You will find him between here and the bluffs to the north-east that overlook the Long Lake. That is where he roams. I do not follow him, no. I leave him to himself and his moods.'
TBD
DNT pursue Athalrik
Defeat Athálrik.
Athálrik falls, a look of malice, fervour, and disbelief twisting his face
DNT search Athalrik for the memory -clothg
You should look for Athálrik, eastward from Víthog.
You find the memory-cloth clutched in his hands.
You should look for Athálrik, eastward from Víthog.
'Well I won't stand for that... or for you!'
DNT Athalrik falls with a grunt and a look of malice on his face
You have found Athálrik. Now confront him.
Pursue Athálrik.
'I will go this far, no farther.'
You should search Athálrik for the Chayasír's memory-cloth.
'Yonder, toward the bluff. You will find him there.'
Instance: The Reach of Justice
'Come now, [placeholder]. See, I have grown strong and full, full of voices!'
'I want no lectures on justice. No. I have seen through time and seen what it is.'
Follow the sounds eastward.
'It is a witless wall that strength and will always topple.'
'I want none of your justice!'
'How are you so strong?'
'I thought I had become stronger than all.'
An anguished cry rises suddenly up ahead, followed by a laugh, then a growl
'I feared nothing...'
'Nothing but the voices I heard. Nothing but losing their song.'
DNT confront athalrik
'Aye, Athálrik!'
'Gaaaaah!'
'Just where do you think you're going?'
'No farther, that's where. Ha ha ha!'
'This one's trouble. Watch yourself!'
A man who must be Athálrik stands, holding something up before him
